.  The Half Moon Bay Coastside is a rural seaside community about 30 miles south of San Francisco, and only an hour's drive from virtually anywhere in the Bay Area.

value: File:Half Moon Bay State Beach (Francis) L1 2007-Aug.jpg

Half Moon Bay's visitor information center offer maps, brochures, directories, and other information for tourists.

value: name=Half Moon Bay Visitor Information Center
directions=from westbound Hwy 92, turn left on to Main Street

hours=M-F 9AM-5PM, Sa-Su 10AM-3PM.  Closed Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, Presidents' Day, Close at 12PM on Good Friday, Easter, Memorial Day, 4th of July, Labor Day, Veteran's Day, Thanksgiving Day & following Friday, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day
content=Visitor Information Center run by the Half Moon Bay Coastside Chamber of Commerce & Visitors' Bureau.

content=The official mobile application of the Half Moon Bay Coastside Chamber of Commerce & Visitors' Bureau with a complete tourist information directory, traffic & transit information, surf, weather & tide forecasts, KHMB local radio, local news, and many other features.

Highway 92 is perfect if you are coming in from either 101 or 280.

If you are coming from San Francisco you can also take 280 to Highway 1 for a very scenic drive through Devil's Slide, which has beautiful, breathtaking cliffs that descend steeply into the ocean. (Unfortunately, this will be bypassed in late 2012 by a tunnel.)
Take Samtrans #294 from Hillsdale Caltrain, or from Pacifica.

value: File:Tide pools at Half Moon Bay.jpg

Almost all of the beaches are on or off of Highway 1 (a.k.a the Pacific Coast Highway) (Note some addresses are given as CA Highway 1, the Cabrillo Highway or the PCH.)

value: name=Bean Hollow State Beach & Pebble Beach
content=Off of Highway 1. Due to the heavy surf and rip tide, swimming is not recommended. You can explore the self-guided nature trail.
content=Off of Highway 1, The entrance to Cowell Ranch is a fairly long hike in and leads to cliffs overlooking the ocean. It is a steep hike down to the beach.
content=Highway 1 to Young Avenue. Sister beach of Venice State Beach and Francis State Beach. Part of the Waterfront Coastside Trail system.
name=Gray Whale Cove State Beach a.k.a Devil's Slide
content=Highway 1. The two nicknames derive from the fact that 1) gray whales can be seen from the beach and 2) there are steep landslide trails. Note – this is a clothing optional beach.

content=From Highway 1 to Kelly Avenue, Sister beach of Venice State Beach and Dunes State Beach. Part of the Waterfront Coastside Trail system. Also home of the Half Moon Bay State Beach headquarters

content=Highway 1 at 2nd Street, One of the more popular beaches in Half Moon bay due to easy access and low hills, the beach provides opportunity for swimming, exploration of tide pools and surf fishing. There is also a lighthouse at Point Montara that has been converted to a bed and breakfast.

content=Highway 1 to Capistrano Road to Pillar Point Harbor. Home of the legendary Mavericks Surf Contest. This area NOT recommended for swimming. (Technically it is not recommend for surfing either but the people who compete in the contest are professional and a tad crazy.) The huge crashing waves are a site to see.
content=Highway 1 to Washington Boulevard to Naples Avenue Part of the Waterfront Coastside Trail system.
content=Highway 1 to Pescadero Road Explore the tide pools or watch the waves crash along the rocks. It's a great place for bird watchers. Sister beach of Pomponio State Beach.
, Off of Highway 1.  Home of the Pigeon Point Lighthouse.
content=Highway 1 to Pescadero Road, This beach is at the base of sand stone cliffs that are not as hard to reach as steeper trails. Sister beach of Pescardero State Beach.
content=Highway 1 to Highway 84 Discovered by Explorer Gaspar de Portolá in 1769, the beach is strewn with driftwood and there is also a bird sanctuary. Note – this is a clothing optional beach.
content=Highway 1 to Venice Boulevard, Sister beach of Dunes State Beach and Francis State Beach. Part of the Waterfront Coastside Trail system.
content=Pillar Point Harbor to Mirada Road. The trail systems goes through Naples / Roosevelt Beach, Dunes Beach, Venice Beach, Francis Beach and Bluff Top Coastal Park.
File:Half Moon Bay foggy mountains at beach.jpg
The fog has come in over the mountains

7 weeks after Easter. Sponsored by IDES Society: +1 650 726-2729

, Main Street between Miramontes and Spruce Streets. Early to Mid October. Sponsored by Half Moon Bay Beautification Committee: +1 650 726-9652
Third Saturday of every month (except October)hotline: +1 650 712-9439
Green Technology open Monday through Saturday:  +1 650 726-7155
content=Serving Half Moon Bay since 1972, Coastside Books has a carefully selected stock of current fiction, biography, history, science and nature, spiritual books, and children's literature.
File:Methodist Episcopal Church at Half Moon Bay, 777 Miramontes St., Half Moon Bay, CA 10-30-2011 11-49-55 AM.JPG
Methodist Episcopal Church at 777 Miramontes St.
name=Ketch Joanne Restaurant and Harbor Bar
content=Food was pretty good and reasonably priced. Service was lacking. Bar becomes popular around 10:30PM

content= Live music Friday and Saturday. The deck has great views and is a great place to sit around the fire pits. It's also dog friendly. NBC's Today Show named the Lobster Roll as one of the five "best sandwiches in America".  However, it is unexpectedly expensive, with no seafood dinner entrees under $20, and reports suggest service quality is poor.
content=Interesting Mediterranean restaurant a short drive north of Half Moon Bay. Very high ratings in Michelin guide, one of the best places to eat on the San Mateo coast.
content=Formerly Obester Winery 12341 San Mateo Rd.
directions=west off Rt. 1 just north of Half Moon Bay

content=Seafood restaurant with an excellent and extensive menu (check out the Half Moon Bay Louie salad with Bay Shrimp) at reasonable prices (they offer half size portions too.) Fast, friendly service. Inside and outside dining with good views of Pillar Point Harbor. They book rock and blues bands on the weekends.
name=Best Western Half Moon Bay Lodge
content=Nice, clean rooms with helpful staff. Environmentally friendly features, including in-room recycling, organic bamboo linens (very comfortable!), and chemical free room cleaning technology.
content=Enjoy original artwork, gourmet breakfasts, and comfy rooms.
content=An elegantly decorated Victorian style Inn 1½ blocks from the beach.
directions=7 miles north of Half Moon Bay
content=Affordable accommodations at a spectacular lighthouse location.

Be careful to check for ticks after hiking in fields in the bay area.  There is a high rate of
in the Bay Area.  If a bulls' eye rash develops at the tick bite site, immediately seek medical help and treatment with antibiotics.
The City of San Francisco is just 25 miles to the North,
is just 40 miles to the South.
